text: Hey guys, welcome to another Nerdy Nummies!

Today I’m gonna be making something Meme
themed, I got so many requests to do

something again that was Meme Themed, so today
I’m gonna be doing Akward Penguin
Appetizers!
Meep-meep-meep-meep-meep!
That sounded like a duck.

The things that we will need today, are going
to be: A cutting board, a peeler,

your favorite knife, this is Sasha, she’s
my favorite, 1 big carrot, a plastic bag,

toothpicks, cream cheese, I don’t use the
light cream cheese or the whipped

cream cheese because you want the really thick
cream cheese so it will stay in place.
Medium sized olives and extra large olives!

These were so easy to make, so let’s get
started!

First you’re gonna take your carrot, you
want to use the big carrot, don’t use

the baby sized, little baby carrots, those
are, those are not gonna work.

And, peel, peel, peel, peel, peel! I’ve
already pre-peeled this, I wanted to

save us some time. Take a knife, and then
you’re going to cut the little penguin's feet

by making these little, I’ll call ‘em
carrot pennies.

My mom used to make me banana pennies, so
these are like carrot pennies.

And they’ll end up look like that, little
round circles.
Boom!
Boom!
Boom!

Now we’re gonna cut out the little beak,
and the feet at the same time.
You’re just gonna cut in like this… Mewp!

And then you’re gonna make a teeny little
triangle, and it’s gonna appear as the

little penguin’s feet, and his beak at the
same time.
Ta-da!
Like so, that’s all you want to do.

Now you're gonna take 1 large olive, these
are extra large olives, that’s OK too!

And you’re gonna want to cut from the bottom
going up, from the circle, not the

X, the circle. So you start at the bottom,
from the circle, and you cut,

up, up, up, up, all the way, almost to the
top.

Cutting out this little sliver. It’s like,
opening his chest cavity.
Hi! That’s kinda creepy!

Now you’re gonna take your cream cheese,
and remember, this isn’t whipped cream

cheese, you want the thick and creamy cream
cheese.

And you’re gonna take a plastic baggie,
and scoop your cream cheese into the bag.
OK, come, come on!

Now you’re going to close your bag, and
work the cream cheese into a corner.

Now you’re gonna take baking scissors and
cut off the top.

And you’re gonna take your extra large olive
that you’ve cut the tuxedo, or his chest

cavity open, whatever… And just fill the
entire olive with cream cheese.
Boom!
So it looks like that.

Then you’re gonna take the small olive,
which is actually a medium sized olive,

and take that little sliver that we cut out
of the carrot, and stick it into the
little part that looks like an X.

With the circle in the back and the X in the
front.

Now we’re gonna take a toothpick and put
it all together!

I got the fancy toothpicks, so fancy I can not
even open them!
Start with the head… Ewwwwwww!
Then get his little body.

Ta-da! He’s done! I’m gonna make a ton
more of these, so they all have little

friends, so they don’t have to be all awkward
by themselves!

I like Awkward Penguin because I think everyone
can relate to it, I’ve had so many

Awkward Penguin moments happen to me in my
real life, like, one time someone
said happy birthday and I said… You too!
That’s awkward…

Or at the movie theater I went to go see Snow
White and the Huntsman and they were

like, have a good movie! And I was like, you
too…
Reep-reep-reep-reep-reep!
Meep!
Ta-da!
Uh, awwww…

Ta-da! Now they’re socally awesome penguins!
They’re so cute!
Ree-ree-ree-ree!

Thanks for watching you guys, if you have
any other ideas or any other suggestions

for any other Nerdy Nummies, please leave
me a comment and let me know and I will
do my best to make it happen.
OK, bye-bye!

Your hors d’oeuvres are served sir! Pro
tip, serve your penguins chilled!
